space.arim.api.platform.sponge

Class SpongeMessages

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.api.platform.AbstractPlatformMessages<org.spongepowered.api.text.Text>
      • space.arim.api.platform.sponge.SpongeMessages
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FormattingManipulator, PlatformFormattingParser<org.spongepowered.api.text.Text>, PlatformMessageConverter<org.spongepowered.api.text.Text>

    public class SpongeMessages
extends AbstractPlatformMessages<org.spongepowered.api.text.Text>
    Enables compatibility with the Sponge API.
    Contains mirror methods for converting between respective API classes.

    Use get() to retrieve the instance for usage.

    Sponge Text API: Comparison with ArimAPI

    Colours and Styles
    ArimAPI uses null values to designate a lack of colouring in a message. The Sponge API avoids null at all costs. Accordingly, its TextColors.NONE and TextStyles.NONE translate to null in ArimAPI. Also, Sponge's TextStyle represents a composite of multiple styles, whereas ArimAPI simply uses an array of Styles.

    Json Messages
    ArimAPI enables tooltips, urls, commands, suggestions, and insertions. The Sponge API has equivalent support for each of these. The Sponge API includes additional hover event and click event actions.
    Author:
    A248

      • convert

        public Colour convert(org.spongepowered.api.text.format.TextColor colour)
        Sponge API -> ArimAPI: Formatting codes
        Converts from a TextColor to a Colour.

        Note that there is no equivalent in ArimAPI for TextColors.NONE and TextColors.REST, so null will be returned if either of these TextColors are passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        colour - the source colour
        Returns:
        the equivalent Colour, or null if there is none

      • colour

        public org.spongepowered.api.text.Text colour(String msg,
                                              FormattingCodePattern formattingPattern)
        Description copied from interface: PlatformFormattingParser
        Adds colour to a message according to the specified formatting code char.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        formattingPattern - the pattern corresponding to the formatting code char
        Returns:
        a coloured Text object

      • uncoloured

        public org.spongepowered.api.text.Text uncoloured(String msg)
        Description copied from interface: PlatformFormattingParser
        Forms a message directly, without explicitly parsing formatting codes.
        Note that, if colour remains in the input string, clients may still see colours.

        This method does not remove colour from a message! Use FormattingManipulator.stripFormatting(String) or FormattingManipulator.stripFormatting(String, FormattingCodePattern) instead.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        Returns:
        a direct result

      • parseJson

        public org.spongepowered.api.text.Text parseJson(String msg,
                                                 FormattingCodePattern formattingPattern)
        Description copied from interface: PlatformFormattingParser
        Parses Json messages based on RezzedUp's json.sk format.

        The following json tags are parsed: ttp, url, cmd, sgt, and ins.
        Colours are parsed according to the specified formatting code char.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        formattingPattern - the pattern corresponding to the formatting code char
        Returns:
        a json formatted result

      • parseUncolouredJson

        public org.spongepowered.api.text.Text parseUncolouredJson(String msg)
        Description copied from interface: PlatformFormattingParser
        Parses Json messages without explicitly parsing formatting codes.
        Note that, if colour remains in the input string, clients may still see colours.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        Returns:
        a json formatted result
